turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1943 World Series.
turn.1: What happened in the 1943 World Series?
turn.2: 1943 World Series The 1943 World Series matched the defending champion St. Louis Cardinals against the New York Yankees, in a rematch of the 1942 Series.
turn.4: The Yankees won the Series in five games for their tenth championship in 21 seasons.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: It was Yankees manager Joe McCarthy's final Series win.
turn.7: What other traditions did this series start?
turn.8: This series was also the first to have an accompanying World Series highlight film (initially, the films were created as gifts to troops fighting in World War II, to give them a brief recap of baseball action back home), a tradition that still persists.
turn.9: What else is notable about this series?
turn.10: This World Series was scheduled for a 3–4 format because of wartime travel restrictions.
turn.12: The 3–4 format meant there was only one trip between ballparks, but if the Series had ended in a four-game sweep, there would have been three games played in one park and only one in the other.
